data.title: Expected More.
data.text:
The service was decent, but the food wasn't very good. Not a lot of choices either. I ate both breakfast and lunch at 6494 Bistro and was disappointed both times. I recommend going out of the hotel for meals. 

Also, the lighting is way too bright, almost blinding. They could also invest in better coffee.

data.title: 6494 Bistro
data.text: I am sorry to say that this is a place to avoid. The wait staff is good but the food average at best. Breakfast was poor. Dinner OKish. It is, however, overpriced.

data.title: Overpriced
data.text: The breakfast was disappointing and over priced. They were way to busy to only have 2 servers working.

data.title: fayetteville fizzle
data.text: We were in downtown Fayetteville for a large gathering (Block Party)  We decided to eat at a new place and the Bistro seemed like a good place.  We were the only customers in the bistro.  We ordered appetizer and did not get it in a timely manner.  When I inquired about it he then brought it out with our lunch.   The server did not ask us if we needed a refill on our drink.   Another server  finally gave us a refill.   I saw our server outside thru the window.   The food was average and not worth the price.   The staff was confused.   I will not return.

data.title: Rehearsal Dinner
data.text: We celebrating the wedding of our son and daughter-in-law and had our rehearsal dinner at the Chancellor.  The staff was amazing from beginning to end.  Jean Guyer is the most amazing lady!  She went above and beyond to make sure everything was perfect for the dinner!

data.title: Good food at an excellent location
data.text: The 6494 Bistro is located in the Chancellor Hotel, just off the Downtown Square. There is a very attractive bar on one side and a restaurant on the other side. As a guest of the hotel I enjoyed my daily breakfast on the restaurant side. Service was prompt and friendly, the food was very good (French toast, omelet, pancakes). I didn't spend any time in the bar, but every evening as I walked past there appeared to be abundant cheerful conversation.

data.title: Great Breakfast
data.text:
With all the great places to eat in Fayetteville, I think 6494 Bistro gets overlooked. Our breakfast was hot and delicious!  The bottomless cup of coffee outstanding. We had oatmeal and French toast. Very tasty!!

Our server was as polite as can be!

Give this place a try!  ENJOY!

data.title: Better than expected
data.text:
We had breakfast here twice during a recent visit.  Our timing was such that it was their brunch menu, which pleased my wife.  She loves hamburgers for brunch and said that it was excellent.   I had a traditional breakfast and it was good. 

Service was fairly attentive and the staff was quite friendly.

data.title: Disappointing service for my wedding day breakfast
data.text:
My bridesmaids and I stayed at the Chancellor hotel the night before my wedding.  Two months before, I called 6494 Bistro and reserved a table for 12 - explaining that this would be for a special gathering the morning of my wedding.  I called to confirm the reservation a couple of weeks before the date of our stay.  The morning of my wedding, we showed up for our reservation only to find that the time was recorded incorrectly.  Luckily they were still able to seat us at a large private table in the back.

The morning started with friendly service as they took our drink orders.  However, 55 minutes later - we remained drink-less.  We had ordered cappuccinos and lattes, and apparently the espresso machine is ran by the same person who takes all of the room-service calls, so he was preoccupied.  We were not notified that these special drinks would take nearly an hour more to deliver, otherwise we would have ordered normal coffees.  

The food also took longer than it should, about 90 minutes from the time we sat down.  We ordered simple breakfast food. 

I was so disappointed with the service, especially after I had done my due diligence to explain exactly what I was looking for that morning by calling the restaurant twice before.  I didn't expect anything too fancy... just timely, relaxed, organized, and friendly service.   

The food and drinks themselves were OK.  Not the tastiest, but not awful.  Definitely not worth the price (they didn't offer to comp our ticket, and only removed the drinks when I asked).

data.title: Bistro at The Chancellor
data.text: BLT - with fried green tomatoes - so good!  Also had very quick service at breakfast.  Best thing about the Bistro is the bar is close - ask for John.

data.title: Breakfast without a banana
data.text: Sadly, the 'fresh fruit' medley lacked the mangoes the waiter mentioned; melon was the substitute (which I can't tolerate/eat) so I was served (tasteless) strawberries and grapes.  What?  No bananas?  How hard would that be?  Ditto cooking 2 eggs over easy--mine were stiff, with one yolk broken; bacon not crisp; plenty of spare grease on the plate; white bread toast--cold--made me wonder if the cook was a Brit; no butter, and two Apple jelly cups.  Just Wow.  Denny's might not have been better, but it would have been less than the $29+ we were charged.  We did not care to try lunch or dinner there.

data.title: Hotel Breakfast
data.text: We had the eggs, bacon and toast which were cooked well. Menu is pricey. Cute little restaurant. First time I have ever been asked how I like my bacon cooked.

data.title: Fine dining in a casual setting
data.text: We ate here two evenings and two breakfasts.  The shrimp and grits and peanut butter bacon burger (think: pad Thai) were excellent.  The quality was much higher than the cost.  There was attention to detail, and generous portion sizes.  I ordered a great omelet, made with feta cheese, spinach, grilled chicken tomatoes and onion.   They customized a pasta dish for a child in our party at dinner. Mike, the chef, visited the dining room to check on our meal. He was genuinely interested in the feedback and was quite pleasant. Our server was a very good young woman whose name escapes me.  The fact that we ate here more than once in an area with many dining options should tell you how good this place is.

data.title: Disappointing Hotel Breakfast
data.text: My fiancé and I stayed at the Chancellor Hotel the night before and came down to the 6494 Bistro for breakfast.  When we arrived at the host stand- we were told to just go sit down and were waved to a dirty table behind the waitress.  I ordered a Latte for $5 and I kid you not, I have never had a latte before that just didn’t “taste”.  It had no flavor at all, like I was drinking a cup of watered down coffee.  I had to have them take it away.  We both then got regular coffees, and asked for refills on the coffee to no avail.  Refills never arrived, even though we asked multiple times.  I ordered a side of fruit with breakfast, and it did not come until we reminded the waitress that we had ordered it.  Breakfast wasn’t overly expensive, we got two regular coffees, OJ, biscuits and gravy and classic eggs and bacon for $15.  The food was not great, as the biscuits and gravy had “skin” that had formed as it was clear the meal had sat in the kitchen window for quite some time.  The melon that came with the side of fruit tasted like it had sat in the same container as an onion, and tasted as such.  In addition the bacon that was served was so greasy that we had to wipe it down.  I do not recommend going to this restaurant unless you are completely out of other options for food anywhere else.

data.title: Good Food
data.text: Had lunch here during a conference. The food was good. Service was a little slow, but we did have a group of about 12. The menu is varied and they offer different specials each day. Price was what is to be expected at an in-house hotel restaurant. Overall, I was pleased with the experience and would eat here again.
